title: The impact of Lutheran migration on music in Australia
abstractText:
The project examines the impact of Lutheran migration on music in Australia, from 1836 to the present day. It looks at the import of German vocal traditions, both secular and sacred, through historic documents, study of contemporary Liedertafel performances and church services and interrogation of the influence of Lutheran missions on indigenous music. 
The role of Lutheran institutions in shaping choral music in Australia will be examined by looking at a selection of commissioned pieces. 
The works of three leading Australian composers with significant Lutheran connections, Andrew Schultz, Graeme Koehne and Ron Nagorcka, will be analysed in detail.
